title: Daily Evening Bhagavatam Discourse | HH Stoka Krishna Swami | SB 1.5.18 | 22-09-2021
speaker: HH Stoka Krishna Swami

segments.summary: The lecture begins with traditional Vaishnava prayers and mantras.

segments.key_quote: Persons who are actually intelligent and philosophically inclined should endeavor only for that purposeful end which is not obtainable even by wandering from the topmost planet, Brahmaloka, down to the lowest planet, Patala.
segments.summary: The speaker introduces the 18th verse of the 5th chapter of the 1st canto of Srimad Bhagavatam, emphasizing that intelligent individuals should strive for something beyond material attainments.
The speaker explains that pure devotional service is the ultimate goal, unattainable through material pursuits in any part of the universe, from Brahmaloka to Patala.

segments.key_quote: It is miseries and mixed material happiness.
segments.summary: The speaker discusses how material happiness and distress are available everywhere, varying based on past karma and circumstances, but ultimately limited and mixed with suffering.

segments.key_quote: Two features of existence in this material world is miseries and mixed happiness.
segments.summary: The speaker elaborates on the inevitability of suffering in material existence, even in higher planets, due to the influence of the three gunas and the inherent miseries of birth, death, disease, and old age.

segments.key_quote: This pure devotional service, by which one can get eternal life, one can get eternal bliss, one can get eternal spiritual knowledge, that is not available by any amount of material activities.
segments.summary: The speaker contrasts material pursuits with pure devotional service, which offers eternal life, bliss, and knowledge, emphasizing that sense enjoyment comes automatically according to destiny.

segments.key_quote: You cannot increase material happiness, you cannot reduce material distress.
segments.summary: The speaker explains the concept of destiny, stating that material endeavors cannot ultimately increase happiness or decrease distress beyond what is already destined, and that even good karma only leads to temporary enjoyment.

segments.key_quote: Whereas, pure devotional service gives us eternal happiness, eternal life, eternal knowledge.
segments.summary: The speaker highlights the eternal benefits of pure devotional service, contrasting it with the anxiety-ridden nature of material existence, even for elevated beings like Lord Brahma.

segments.key_quote: Only for that one should endeavor.
segments.summary: The speaker reiterates the importance of striving for advancement in Krishna Consciousness and pure devotional service, emphasizing its ability to free one from anxiety and provide eternal benefits that are never lost.

segments.key_quote: Krishna wants every one of His parts and parcels in this material world to engage in pure devotional service and return to Him in His personal abode for leading an eternal life full of bliss and knowledge.
segments.summary: The speaker concludes by emphasizing Krishna's desire for all beings to engage in devotional service and return to His blissful abode, offering eternal life and knowledge, and ends with a Hare Krishna mantra.
